meanings.definition: The final part of a joke that makes it funny.
meanings.sent1: She always remembers the punchlines of jokes.
meanings.sent2: The comedian delivered the punchline perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The punchlines in his jokes always leave us laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her witty punchlines hit the audience just right.
meanings.sent5: The punchline of the joke was so unexpected and hilarious.

meanings.definition: A line at the end of a story or speech that emphasizes the main point.
meanings.sent1: The punchlines in his speeches are always powerful.
meanings.sent2: The author concluded the story with a strong punchline.
meanings.sent3: His speech had a punchline that left everyone thinking.
meanings.sent4: The punchline of the story drove home the message.
meanings.sent5: The punchline at the end of the tale was thought-provoking.

meanings.definition: A line in a song or poem that stands out and is memorable.
meanings.sent1: The song's punchlines are catchy and easy to remember.
meanings.sent2: The poet's use of punchlines made the poem engaging.
meanings.sent3: The punchlines in the song stuck in my head all day.
meanings.sent4: Her poem was filled with beautiful punchlines.
meanings.sent5: The punchline of the song echoed in my mind long after it ended.
